subject: Re: [junit] A case for adding logging of assertions to junit

messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On Mon, Jun 9, 2008 at 5:39 PM, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...> wrote:
>> I believe that if JUnit logged its assertions, then
>> that would have robbed me of this experience.
>
> That's quite puzzling. I can't see how the existence of this feature
> could ever prevent a developer from writing tests.

I don't think that's what Joe said. I understood him to say that it
would have prevented him from being nudged to write *better* tests.
Having that easy solution would have prevented him from finding the
*better* solution.

My experience matches his. I also initially had the desire to know about
the execution of single assertions. I've come to the conclusion that
growing out of that desire was better than satisfying it would have been.

Cheers, Ilja
